_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



The management and employees of this Nutrien Ag Solutions Levelland, TX facility are committed to the prevention of any release of chemicals handled at the facility.  If a release should occur, this facility is prepared to work with the local or state hazardous material team, the local fire department, the local or state administering agency, the tribal natural resource manager and our emergency response contractor to control, contain and clean up the release.



2. Facility Information (Stationary Source and regulated substance(s))



The primary activity at this facility is: Delinting Cotton Seed



This facility stores and handles one regulated substance(s) Anhydrous Hydrochloric Acid. It is also used at the facility for the production of Delinted Cotton Seed (non-regulated substance(s)).



3. Worst-Case and Alternative Release Scenarios



This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative release scenario, however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by the US EPA.



4. Accidental Release Prevention Program



This facility complies with the following standards, codes and regulations:



?National Electrical Code

?Uniform Fire Code

?29 CFR 1920.38 Emergency Action Plans

?29 CFR 1910.39 Fire Prevention Plans

?29 CFR 1910.120(p)(8) and (q) Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response





5. Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of Anhydrous Hydrochloric Acid at this facility during the past five years.



6. Emergency Response Program



This facility has prepared and implemented a written Emergency Plan that complies with state and federal regulations.  The Plan specifies the lines of authority, the roles and responsibilities individuals are to assume, and the specific actions to be taken and response limits for personnel during a release of a regulated substance.  The Plan includes proced

ures to follow for fires, explosions, medical emergencies, spills and releases and natural disasters such as earthquakes and flooding. It includes procedures for informing the public and local agencies responsible for responding to accidental releases.  The Plan includes information on emergency healthcare and the name and telephone number of the local agency with which emergency response activities and the Plan are coordinated.

 

7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility.  Improvements to existing safety procedures and practices are determined through periodic inspections and audits.
